documentContentReferences.name: SoA Change Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the 'Protocol Amendment Summary of Changes Table' to Section 8, detailing procedures for screening sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to the COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 (Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy) to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation procedures.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes the adaptive features of the study design.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 (Adaptive Protocol Features) to Table 7 for criteria on when a dose should be decreased or interrupted.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraception Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Participant Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 10.4 for details on appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the Schedule of Activities for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: ECG Timing Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 to the SoA for the schedule of conducting 12-lead ECGs.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Reporting Procedures
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: PK Sample Collection Schedule
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of whole blood sample collection for PK measurements.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the population sets used for analyses.

commentAnnotations.text: This amendment is considered to be substantial based on the criteria set forth in Article 10(a) of Directive 2001/20/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union, the US Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) regulation at 21 CFR part 312.30(b), and any applicable local regulations.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Protocol Amendment 3.1 specific to the US.
